title: Support for s10 galaxy series
body:
# Problem

there is no camera on screenshots, in most cases camera cut the UI elements in the toolbar

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11790366/56277931-8f64f600-6105-11e9-92f7-6860fb079733.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11790366/56277958-9c81e500-6105-11e9-8c18-9fe0d13c2502.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11790366/56277983-aa376a80-6105-11e9-807a-6a24ec276afb.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11790366/56277997-b1f70f00-6105-11e9-8515-198f5215cdc7.png)

Padding for address bar in Browser needs to be the same when url is opened as when no url is opened (10px).

![IMG_0113](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35233054/58168779-60571c80-7c8f-11e9-9df3-05c55e5e47fe.JPG)
![IMG_0112](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35233054/58168783-63eaa380-7c8f-11e9-970c-020ce400f728.JPG)

@errorists believe this fix is required regardless of changes to RN, as it's an inconsistency of the address bar padding between Main browser screen and opened url browser screen.

cc @rachelhamlin
@hesterbruikman ur right, needs a fix
Thanks for the images @hesterbruikman. I'll put an xs bounty on it. If we maintain the same padding across main screen and opened browser window that will solve it?

Our top toolbar should start at the position of the cutout, to make it right we'd need to ask the magic number where the cutout ends to position the UI correctly. I'd assume it's possible to fetch this position from RN. There is the safeAreaView we already use for new iPhones where we position the toolbar at 44px from the top, same needs to happen for S10.
Adding to this; Chat view shows the same issue although it's less severe as there is no component obtruded by the camera. Still needs the safeAreaView equivalent.

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done

Oh, sorry for the inconvenience! I was thinking about how to fix it.... but please take me off it! This is so hard for me:( Good luck for your work!
Okay, thanks for your reply @HackerEunji :) All the best.
